recommended by your yarn manufacturer stitches used k p s1 k1 psso © akabekobotan 2022 the pictured project was made using carnival 8ply acrylic and a dollar shop brandless dk yarn in the right colour that i happened on while out shopping you can substitute any other dk yarn in your favourite colour and fibre you can use your preferred cast on for this project but i prefer to use the tubular cast on in the round as demonstrated here https //www youtube com/watch v=agtsfho_p_e note that this method requires that you cast on half the number of stitches with scrap yarn to begin with this pattern assumes you are not using this method to cast on and begins with the total number of stitches for the hat band 120 body start with mc using smaller needles co 120 st join to work in the round work in 2x2 rib until work measures 4cm in length change to larger needles and work 4 rounds in stockinette stitch work chart 1 from the lower right-hand corner shaded squares represent cc1 break mc yarn work 4 rounds of stockinette in cc1 work chart 2 from the lower right-hand corner shaded squares represent cc2 break cc1 yarn chart 1 chart 2 12 12 11 11 10 10 9 9 8 8 7 7 6 6 5 5 4 4 3 3 2 2 1 1 © akabekobotan 2022 crown shaping round 1 knit pm every 12 st round 2 *k to 2 st before marker sl1 k1 psso* repeat to end of round round 3 knit repeat round 2 and 3 four more times repeat round 2 until 10 stitches remain break yarn leaving a long tail run the end of the yarn through remaining stitches twice and pull tight to close use the end of the yarn from the body of the hat to sew a button over the top of the hat alternatively make a pompom with either mc or cc2 and attach to top of the hat weave in all ends © akabekobotan 2022
